Turtle

Class Turtle

  • java.lang.Object
    • Turtle.Turtle

  • public class Turtle
extends java.lang.Object
    Turtle class, implements a LOGO Turtle for Processing
    Author:
    Leah Buechley

      Constructor and Description
      Turtle(processing.core.PApplet theParent)
      Basic constructor, creates a Turtle in the middle of the screen.

      Copy constructor, creates a copy of the input Turtle.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Turtle

        public Turtle(processing.core.PApplet theParent)
        Basic constructor, creates a Turtle in the middle of the screen.
        Parameters:
        theParent - parent sketch in which Turtle is generated.

      • Turtle

        public Turtle(Turtle T)
        Copy constructor, creates a copy of the input Turtle.
        Parameters:
        T - creates a new Turtle using parameters from the input Turtle, T.

    • Method Detail

      • forward

        public void forward(float distance)
        Move Turtle forward.
        Parameters:
        distance - number of steps (maps to pixels) to move.

      • back

        public void back(float distance)
        Move Turtle backward.
        Parameters:
        distance - number of steps (maps to pixels) to move.

      • right

        public void right(float angle)
        Turn Turtle to the right.
        Parameters:
        angle - degrees to turn.

      • left

        public void left(float angle)
        Turn Turtle to the left.
        Parameters:
        angle - degrees to turn.

      • penUp

        public void penUp()
        Set Turtle's pen state to PENUP.

      • penDown

        public void penDown()
        Set Turtle's pen state to PENDOWN.

      • push

        public void push()
        Save ("push") Turtle's current state to the stack.

      • pop

        public void pop()
        Return Turtle to last saved state and remove ("pop") that state from the stack.

      • distanceFromPoint

        public float distanceFromPoint(float x,
                      float y)
        Calculate Turtle's distance from a point.
        Parameters:
        x - x coordinate of point.
        y - y coordinate of point.

      • closeToPath

        public boolean closeToPath(float distance)
        Answer question: if Turtle moves forward a distance will it cross its previous path.
        Parameters:
        distance - distance to move forward.

        Set the X coordinate of Turtle's current position.

      • setY

        public void setY(float y)
        Set the Y coordinate of Turtle's current position.
        Parameters:
        y - Y coordinate

      • setHeading

        public void setHeading(float theta)
        Set the Turtle's current heading (angle).
        Parameters:
        theta - angle input, in degrees

      • setPenState

        public void setPenState(int penStateInput)
        Set the Turtle's current pen state. Use discouraged. Use penUp() and penDown() instead.
        Parameters:
        penStateInput - PENUP=1, PENDOWN=0, PENFAT=3

      • setWrapAround

        public void setWrapAround(boolean wrap)
        Turn wrap-around on and off. When wrap==TRUE, turtle will never "fall off" the edge of the page. Turtle will reappear on opposite edge when she leave screen.
        Parameters:
        wrap -

      • goToPoint

        public void goToPoint(float xInput,
             float yInput)
        Jump Turtle to input point.
        Parameters:
        xInput - X coordinate of point
        yInput - Y coordinate of point

      • curveToPoint2

        public void curveToPoint2(float xInput,
                 float yInput,
                 float angleInput)

      • curveToPoint

        public void curveToPoint(float xInput,
                float yInput)

      • draw

        public void draw()
        Draw method; draw Turtle's history to the screen. You shouldn't call this directly unless you use PApplet.noLoop(). Will be called automatically by Processing.

      • printTurtleHistory

        public void printTurtleHistory()

      • clearTurtleHistory

        public void clearTurtleHistory()
        Delete the Turtle's previous history and clear all previous drawing.

      • drawTurtle

        public void drawTurtle()
        Draw the Turtle (a small blue triangle) on the screen.
